author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two men died after being hit by trains in separate accidents on Wednesday.

Railway police sources said K. Veerappan (48) of Periya Nathamedu, Chengalpattu, tried to board an unreserved compartment of the Chennai Egmore-Madurai weekly express which had started moving from platform no. 7. In the impact, he suffered severe head injuries and died on the spot, police said. His body was taken to Tambaram Taluk Government Hpospital in Chromepet and handed over to relatives on Thursday after a post-mortem examination.

In another incident, 25-year-old R. Devaraj was hit by a suburban electric multiple unit (EMU) between the Pallavaram and Chromepet railway stations, the police said.

Further investigations are currenly underway.
title: Two men killed in separate train accidents in city
